;华盛顿（路透社）- 美国经济活动要么更弱，要么不如之前估计的那么强劲。周四修订后的政府数据显示，2020 年、2021 年和 2022 年三个季度的评级下调主要是由于消费者支出。

;;
;;2022 年 12 月 4 日，美国纽约市萨克斯第五大道，人们乘坐自动扶梯。 REUTERS/ Jeenah Moon;
;

;但负责编制国内生产总值报告的政府机构经济分析局 (BEA) 表示，没有证据表明残留季节性因素多年来一直困扰着 GDP 数据以前，这是一个问题。

;

;政府调整经济数据，以消除通常每年在大致相同时间和幅度发生的季节性天气模式和假期等波动，以使该系列更易于解释和分析。但即使在对数据进行季节性调整后，季节性影响在某些情况下仍然存在。在政府于 2018 年解决该问题之前，这种情况在第一季度 GDP 数据中最为普遍。

;

;当时，残留季节性往往会低估第一季度的经济增长。

;

;“我们提出了一整套协议和机制，我们将对其进行检查，以确保我们没有残留季节性。”BEA 国民经济账户副主任 Dave Wasshausen 告诉记者。

;

;“因此，我们继续进行所有这些测试、检查，只是为了看看是否存在残留季节性，但实际上没有。我们没有看到任何特别的事情让我们对持久性成分的上调或下调感到犹豫。”

;

;2020 年第一季度的 GDP 被下调，显示其年化率收缩 5.3%，相反较之前报道的 4.6% 的增幅有所下降。但 2020 年全年 GDP 上调了 0.6 个百分点，显示经济在第三季度和第四季度表现强劲的情况下收缩了 2.2%。

;

;2021 年第一季度 GDP 增长 5.2%由于消费者支出修正较低，增长率高于之前公布的 6.3%。全年增长率从 5.9% 下调至 5.8%，反映出州和地方政府支出、联邦政府支出和非住宅固定投资的下调。

;

;2022 年，GDP 收缩了 2.0%。第一季度增速较之前公布的 1.6% 下调。目前估计消费者支出持平，而不是之前报告的 1.3% 增长率，这是下调评级的原因。

;

;全年经济增长率下调 0.2 个百分点，至 1.9%，这是消费者支出、库存投资、州和地方政府支出和出口下调以及进口上调的结果。

;

;年度基准修订纳入了 2017 年经济普查的结果。参考年份从2012年改为2017年。从2017年到2022年，经济形势变化不大，GDP年均增长率为2.2%，高于此前估计的2.1%。

;

; COVID-19大流行衰退仍然是有记录以来最严重的，从2019年第四季度到2020年第二季度，经济平均收缩17.5%，修正后为0.7个百分点。复苏速度为历史第二快。

;

;从收入方面衡量，2017年至2022年经济平均增长率为2.3%。国内总收入（GDI）高出0.2个百分点

;

;一些经济学家关注季度 GDP 与 GDI 之间的差距，认为经济并不像最近数据显示的那么强劲。

;

;尽管这种差距或统计差异在 2022 年第四季度扩大，全年收窄，占 GDP 的 -0.2%，而不是之前报告的 -0.6%。到 2022 年，这一差距将低于 GDP 的 0.1%（从 -0.6% 修正为 0.1%）。

;

;“值得注意的是，过去 50 年占 GDP 比重的平均统计差异约为 0.9%，”表示瓦斯豪森。 “根据 2017 年以后的最新数据，这三年的份额均为 0.3% 或更少。因此，通过这次更新，我们对统计差异的位置感到非常满意。”

;

;2022 年美联储开始加息时，通货膨胀率比之前报告的要高一些。剔除食品和能源的个人消费支出价格指数去年增长5.2%，上调为5.0%。

;

;2022年第一、第三和第四季度核心PCE价格指数上调。

;

;;美国总统乔·拜登在美国加利福尼亚州旧金山与总统科学技术顾问委员会 (PCAST​​) 举行的会议上发表讲话，2023 年 9 月 27 日。路透社/Evelyn Hockstein;
;

;总统乔·拜登将于周四发表讲话，警告美国民主面临威胁，;在 2024 年大选之前再次攻击共和党人唐纳德·特朗普及其盟友，这很可能是另一次两人之间的对峙。

;

;拜登在亚利桑那州凤凰城的讲话也将纪念已故亚利桑那州共和党参议员约翰·麦凯恩的遗产，他是 2008 年共和党总统候选人，于 2018 年去世。拜登和麦凯恩仍然存在尽管存在深刻的政治分歧，但还是朋友。

;

;根据演讲中准备好的言论，拜登将警告“美国正在发生一些危险的事情”。 “有一个极端主义运动与我们民主的基本信念不同。MAGA 运动。”

;

;拜登会说，他不认为所有共和党人都将“MAGA”议程归咎于“MAGA”议程，即“MAGA”议程。特朗普的口号是“让美国再次伟大”。但他会说，“毫无疑问，今天的共和党受到了 MAGA 极端分子的驱使和恐吓。”

;

;拜登的讲话是在政府可能关闭的几天前发表的，这种情况是由忠于唐纳德·特朗普的共和党人造成的。

;

;拜登寻求连任之际，人们担心他的高龄（他将于 11 月年满 81 岁）以及美国的经济担忧。他加大了对潜在风险的警告力度;特朗普对民主构成的威胁; 以 2021 年 1 月 6 日美国国会大厦遇袭事件为例。

;

;周三晚上在旧金山举行的一场竞选筹款活动上，拜登表示，他参加竞选的部分原因是“美国的政治暴力是永远，永远，永远，永远不可接受。”

;

;“唐纳德·特朗普和 MAGA 共和党人决心摧毁美国民主，因为他们想要打破制度结构，”他说。

;

;特朗普面临多项指控，包括他在 1 月 6 日骚乱中所扮演的角色，这场骚乱导致数人死亡、100 多名警察受伤。他最近几周建议前参谋长;该被杀;，司法部;应该;。

;

;白宫官员表示，拜登在凤凰城附近的亚利桑那州坦佩发表的言论将是一系列有关民主威胁的演讲中的第四次。

;

;拜登还将宣布从 1.9 万亿美元资金;美国救援组织提供资金计划;与麦凯恩研究所和亚利桑那州立大学合作建设麦凯恩图书馆。

;

;拜登的演讲紧随 2024 年第二次;周三在加利福尼亚州举行的共和党总统辩论;，辩论经常演变成不和谐的声音、小打小闹和奇怪的评论由七名候选人组成。 ;了解更多;

;

;再次缺席辩论的特朗普被佛罗里达州州长罗恩·德桑蒂斯贴上“行动失踪”的标签，而前新泽西州州长克里斯·克里斯蒂则嘲笑他是“唐老鸭”。

;

;特朗普反而给出了;在底特律向汽车工人发表演讲;，他攻击了拜登对电动汽车的支持。 ;了解更多;

;周四，欧盟移民部长在布鲁塞尔开会讨论如何处理抵达的难民和移民，目光聚焦德国;柏林;和罗马担心移民增加，通过海运在关键选举之前。

;

;部长们正在寻求就长期停滞的制度达成一致，该制度将在欧盟范围内分担从官方过境点之外到达欧洲的寻求庇护者。

;

;外交官我们希望德国内政部长南希·费瑟 (Nancy Faeser) 向布鲁塞尔提出一项联合协议，以允许柏林支持所谓的“危机机制”，以分配人员以避免压倒意大利和其他入境国家。

;

;欧盟 27各国政府希望在 2024 年泛欧盟议会选举之前落实这一措施，以控制选民。

;

;费瑟在与欧盟同行进行会谈时表示，她期待取得积极成果。她的评论得到了会议主席西班牙内政部长的回应：“我希望最终我们能够在这方面给你们带来好消息，”费尔南多格兰德·马拉斯卡告诉记者。

;

;“这将使......在立法机关结束之前我们将真正拥有一项完全有效的移民协议，这就是我们想要的。”

;< p>;周三，德国;宣布新的边境管制;通常是欧洲的开放旅行区，以打击人口走私。

;

;与邻国波兰和捷克共和国的边境检查是为了应对今年迄今为止庇护申请增加近 80% 的情况，人们对中左翼执政联盟在下个月巴伐利亚地方选举中面临极右翼挑战的担忧。

;

;此类控制突显了处理中东和非洲逃离战争和贫困的人的困难欧盟高级外交官表示，“显然，没有人对新的内部边境管制感到满意”，并补充说，关于“危机机制”的协议将加强欧盟的合作陷入困境的移民体系并减少采取此类措施的必要性。

;

;然而，移民专家警告;执行任何此类协议都存在实际困难;，而人权组织则对日益严厉的反移民法侵犯人权发出警告。

;

;部长们还将与埃及讨论一项潜在协议，以防止更多人从地中海南岸登船前往欧洲。

;

;;批评者;表示，最近与突尼斯达成的此类协议在人权方面存在不足，但随着罗马对< a href="/world/europe/eu-chief-pledges-migrant-action-plan-italys-lampedusa-2023-09-17/">;兰佩杜萨;抵达人数超过2022年意大利总理乔治亚·梅洛尼获胜时的人数意大利的数据显示，2023 年迄今为止，有超过 133,000 人从海上抵达，而该国创纪录的 2016 年则接近 181,500 人。联合国的另一数据显示，有超过 191,000 人非正常抵达今年进入了拥有 4500 万人的欧盟。

;

;自 2015 年超过 100 万人抵达欧盟以来，欧盟一直在推行更严厉的政策来遏制非正常移民，这让欧盟措手不及，势不可挡包括意大利在内的国家。

;

;与此同时，他们在如何分担照顾那些抵达欧洲的人的任务上存在严重分歧。

;

;与波兰和匈牙利领导那些坚决反对收容任何来自中东或非洲的寻求庇护者的人，当27国最后一次在夏天寻求达成协议时，没有足够的票数支持拟议的“危机机制”。如果德国周四投了赞成票，这种情况将会改变。

;

;欧盟委员玛格丽蒂斯·希纳斯 (Margaritis Schinas) 在部长级会谈中表示，“我们比以往任何时候都更加接近”。

;

;他表示，达成协议将“最终”剥夺欧洲煽动者和民粹主义者的论点“我们无法解决我们的移民问题。”

;政府周四证实，美国经济在第二季度保持了相当强劲的增长速度，并且似乎在劳动力市场坚韧的背景下，本季度的经济增长势头强劲。

;

;美国商务部在周四对 4 月至 6 月期间 GDP 的第三次估计中表示，上季度国内生产总值年化增长率未经修正为 2.1% 。路透社调查的经济学家此前预计第二季度 GDP 不会被修改。

;

;第一季度增长率从之前报告的 2.0% 上调至 2.2%。

;

;政府还修订了 2017 年的 GDP 数据，纳入新的来源信息，并进行了一些统计改进，例如对受监管投资公司和房地产投资信托的处理。

;

;GDP 在 2017 年第一季度的每个季度均被下调。 2020年、2021年和2022年的增长主要是由于消费者支出增长的下调。但制作 GDP 报告的机构经济分析局 (BEA) 表示，没有证据表明几年前困扰 GDP 数据的残留季节性是一个问题。

;

;政府还推出了新的价格指标，即不包括食品、能源和住房的个人消费支出（PCE）价格指数，以及不包括能源和住房的PCE服务，即所谓的超级核心通胀。

;

;美联储官员的重点是当他们试图衡量对抗通货膨胀的进展时，他们会考虑超级核心价格指标。自 2022 年 3 月以来，美联储已将基准隔夜利率上调 525 个基点，至目前的 5.25%-5.50% 区间。

;

;经济正受到富有弹性的劳动力市场的支撑，这正在推动工资大幅增长。目前对 7 月至 9 月季度的增长预测高达 4.9%。

;

;但由于美国众议院共和党人在支出问题上的激烈内讧，政府关闭迫在眉睫，可能会削弱第四季度的增长势头.

;

;如果国会不为 10 月 1 日开始的新财政年度提供资金，数十万联邦工作人员将被迫休假，从财务监督到医学研究的广泛服务将被暂停.

;

;汽车工人联合会针对通用汽车的持续罢工也给经济蒙上了阴影;(GM.N);，Stellantis ;(STLAM. MI); 和福特汽车 ;(FN);，预计会抑制汽车的发展生产汽车并提高汽车价格。大约两周前开始的罢工已经对供应链产生了连锁反应。

;

;到目前为止，劳动力市场继续保持稳定。美国劳工部周四发布的第二份报告显示，截至 9 月 23 日当周，初请失业金人数增加 2,000 人，达到季节性调整后的 204,000 人。经济学家此前预测最近一周申请失业救济人数为 215,000 人。

;

;初请失业金人数增加今年处于 194,000-265,000 范围的下限。索赔报告显示，在截至 9 月 16 日的一周内，在最初一周的援助（招聘的替代指标）后领取福利的人数增加了 12,000 人，达到 167 万人。

;

;所谓的持续索赔涵盖政府对家庭九月份失业率进行调查的时期。八月和九月调查周期间，持续申领失业救济人数几乎没有变化。 8 月失业率从 7 月的 3.5% 升至 3.8%。

;

;据 PA Media 援引家人声明报道，他在医院安详地去世。

;

;Gambon 开始了他于 20 世纪 60 年代初登台表演，后来进入电视和电影领域。著名的电影角色包括 1989 年彼得·格林纳威 (Peter Greenaway) 的《厨师、小偷、他的妻子和她的情人》中的精神病黑帮头目，以及 2010 年汤姆·胡珀 (Tom Hooper) 的《国王的演讲》中年老的乔治五世国王。

;

;但他最出名的角色是《哈利·波特》系列中的邓布利多，这是他在 2004 年接替已故的理查德·哈里斯后，从八部电影系列的第三部中接任的角色。甘本淡化了对他表演的赞扬。并说他只是扮演自己“留着胡子，穿着长袍”。

;

;迈克尔·约翰·甘本 (Michael John Gambon) 1940 年 10 月 19 日出生于都柏林，母亲是裁缝，父亲是工程师。 Gambon 六岁时，全家搬到了伦敦的卡姆登镇，因为他的父亲在伦敦战后重建中寻找工作。

;

;Gambon 15 岁时离开学校，开始了工程学徒生涯，到 21 岁时，他完全获得了资格。然而，他也是一个业余戏剧团体的成员，并且一直知道自己会表演，2004 年他告诉《先驱报》。他受到美国演员马龙·白兰度和詹姆斯·迪恩的启发，他认为他们反映了十几岁男孩的焦虑。< /p>;

;1962 年，他参加了伟大的莎士比亚演员奥利维尔的试镜，奥利维尔使他成为老维克国家剧院的创始成员之一，其他年轻的新兴巨星包括德里克·雅各比和玛吉·史密斯。

;

;Gambon 在接下来的几年里在舞台上建立了自己的声誉，尤其是 1980 年在约翰·德克斯特 (John Dexter) 的《伽利略传》中扮演的伽利略而出名。

;

;20 世纪 80 年代，他的主演作品引起了更广泛的关注。 1986年，他在电视剧《歌声侦探》中扮演一位患有皮肤病的作家，他的想象力是他摆脱痛苦的唯一途径。这场表演为他赢得了四项英国电影和电视艺术学院奖之一。

;

;他还凭借 2001 年的《戈斯福德公园》和《国王的演讲》赢得了三项奥利弗奖和两项美国演员工会奖。

;< p>;甘本于 1992 年被授予大英帝国司令勋章，并于 1998 年因对戏剧的贡献而被封为爵士，他称这是“一份不错的小礼物”，尽管他没有使用这个头衔。

;

;性格顽皮，他经常编故事。多年来，他向其他演员展示了一张罗伯特·德尼罗的签名照片，事实上，这张照片是他在见到这位美国演员之前就亲手题写的。

;

;他在爱尔兰的《深夜秀》一集中透露，他让他的母亲相信他是教皇的朋友。

;

;Gambon 在遭受长期记忆问题后于 2015 年退出舞台，但继续在银幕上表演直到 2019 年。他在 2002 年告诉一位采访者，他的工作使他感觉“世界上最幸运的男人”。

;

;Gambon 于 1962 年与 Anne Miller 结婚，并育有一子。虽然他们从未离婚，但后来他又有了另一位伴侣，比他小 25 岁的布景设计师菲利帕·哈特 (Philippa Hart)，两人育有两个孩子。

; Thu, 28 Sep 2023 20:25:03 +0800 French state faces landmark class action for police racial profilinghttps://reuters.com/article/france-police-class-action/french-state-faces-landmark-class-action-for-police-racial-profiling-idUSKBN30Y0XF
;;2023-09-28T11:27:37Z;
;;
;;People walk past the Conseil d'Etat, France's highest administrative court, in Paris, France, August 16, 2021. REUTERS/Sarah Meyssonnier/File Photo;
;

;France's highest administrative court will on Friday consider its first class action against the state, alleging racial profiling by police - and may in the process shape future social activism.

;

;Six human rights organisations argue that the police systematically discriminate, especially against young Arab and Black men, when deciding who to stop on routine patrols.

;

;If successful, they could open the way for similar broad legal challenges in a country where activism has traditionally taken the form of direct protest, and where class actions only became possible in 2014 and remain rare.

;

;The case, supported by statements from 40 victims as well as police, asks the Conseil d'Etat (State Council) to require concrete reforms from the government, including limiting police powers to check ID and mandating a record of checks.

;

;"It is not acceptable that kids, at a young age, have to learn that their skin colour is a problem," said Omer Mas Capitolan, president of one of the six organisations, Community House of Development in Solidarity.

;

;The government and police are already under scrutiny after an officer shot dead Nahel, a teenager of North African descent, during a traffic stop in June, bringing long-simmering resentment among urban immigrant communities to the boil.

;

;The UN Committee for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination decried the "continuing practice of racial profiling" and urged France to address "structural and systemic causes of racial discrimination" in the police.

;

;The interior ministry did not answer a request for comment, but has previously said that "ethnic profiling by law enforcement is banned", and that racism in the police is not systemic.

;

;However, France limits the use of statistics on race and ethnicity, and experts say it can no longer turn a blind eye to accusations by rights groups that racism colours police recruitment, training, doctrine and practice.

;

;Since 2016, France has paid damages to individuals in three cases where police ID checks were found to have been discriminatory.

;

;But the lawsuit - before a chamber reserved for cases of "remarkable importance" - does not seek monetary compensation.

;

;"It's looking to the future - to trace all the necessary ways to eradicate this wrong," said Antoine Lyon-Caen, lawyer for the six organisations, which include Amnesty, Human Rights Watch and the Open Society Justice Initiative.

;

;Since 2014, France has allowed organisations to file lawsuits on behalf of a group harmed by a policy or practice, later widening their application beyond consumer claims. Such actions often fail, though, and lawmakers are discussing ways to facilitate them.

;

;In the US, class actions have long featured in civil rights advocacy.

;

;In France, however, "judicial advocacy is not a tradition, this is a first, the tradition [here] is going onto the streets," said Sophie Latraverse, a lawyer and anti-discrimination expert.

;

;In arguments provided to the court, Lyon-Caen cites as a model a 2013 ruling against New York city over racial profiling and unconstitutional police stop-and-search practices.

;

;"This US judgment brings hope as it puts in place measures to transform the police, and a monitoring mechanism," he said.

;

;As for Friday's verdict, Gwénaële Calvès, law professor at University Cergy-Pontoise, said it would also send a wider message on class actions in France: "'Go for it' - or - 'It's not worth it'."

;

;A member of the Conseil d'Etat will make a recommendation at Friday's hearing and a judgment will follow in the coming weeks.

; Thu, 28 Sep 2023 19:55:03 +0800 EU governments thrash out how to make enlarged bloc workhttps://reuters.com/article/eu-enlargement/eu-governments-thrash-out-how-to-make-enlarged-bloc-work-idUSKBN30Y0YZ
;;2023-09-28T11:41:27Z;
;;
;;European flags fly outside the European Commission headquarters in Brussels, Belgium September 20, 2023. REUTERS/Yves Herman/File Photo;
;

;The challenges of expanding the European Union by up to eight countries were being discussed by governments on Thursday, with significant changes to the bloc's decision-making, agriculture and regional aid budgets needed if it is to grow further.

;

;The talks among EU affairs ministers of the 27 current members states in the Spanish town of Murcia are to lay the groundwork for an EU summit on Oct 5-6.

;

;"Today is a council that prepares the summit in 10 days with a discussion on enlargement," French Europe Minister Laurence Boone told reporters on entering the meeting.

;

;Eight countries currently have official EU candidate status - Turkey, Ukraine, Moldova, Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia - while two, Georgia and Kosovo, are potential candidate countries.

;

;"We have to prepare ourselves to take decisions with more than 30 members," German Europe Minister Anna Luhrmann said.

;

;Guiding the talks will be a ;paper; prepared by French and German scholars which calls for a radical overhaul of the EU's decision-making and funding before it can accept more countries by a tentative deadline of 2030.

;

;Decision-making is key because the EU now requires unanimity on foreign and security policy, taxes, EU finances, some areas of justice and home affairs and social security and protection.

;

;This has already been criticised by some governments and experts as either substantially slowing or even blocking the EU's development, as all decisions in these areas have to be reduced to the lowest common denominator.

;

;Yet changes would require amendments to EU treaties, a long and difficult process that itself would require unanimity.

;

;"It is already difficult to take decisions among the 27, so we need to reform the way we function, our institutional setup, to work properly with more member states," Portuguese Europe Minister Tiago Antunes said.

;

;"We also have to look at the impact of enlargement on major policies of the EU like the agriculture policy and regional policy, the impact it will have on the European budget and we will also discuss differentiated, gradual integration," he said.

;

;EU agriculture policy would need to be revamped because the admission of agriculture powerhouse Ukraine would dramatically change current EU direct payments to farmers.

;

;A similarly major change would happen to the EU's regional policy, under which poorer EU members receive money to raise their standard of living.

;

;The agriculture and regional funds make up two thirds of the EU budget, which totals roughly 1% of the bloc's gross national income a year. The Franco-German paper said the budget, worth around a trillion euros in 2021-27, should be bigger -- a highly contested idea in the EU.

;

;The paper, which polarised EU governments when first discussed on Sept. 19, said some countries in the EU should be allowed to form closer cooperation than others, forming four tiers of European integration.

;

;The deepest integration would be in the inner circle similar to the euro zone using the single currency and the passport-free Schengen travel zone.

;

;The second tier would be the EU itself, a yet larger circle would be made up of Associate Members who would participate in the EU's single market for goods and services and adhere to the EU's common principles.

;

;Finally there would be the European Political Community - a forum proposed by France that was launched last year - as an outer tier for political cooperation without having to be bound to EU law, it said.

;(Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin met Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov on Thursday, a state television reporter said, three days after Kadyrov said he was proud of his 15-year-son for beating up a prisoner accused of burning the Koran.

;

;A short video clip posted by TV reporter Pavel Zarubin showed the two men exchanging opening remarks, with no reference to the beating episode that drew condemnation even from some pro-Kremlin hardliners.

;

;Putin said that there was a “positive dynamic” in Chechnya, largely thanks to Kadyrov and his team. Kadyrov was shown handing him some papers from a file.

;

;Putin has allowed Kadyrov free rein to run the southern Muslim region as a personal fiefdom in return for keeping it stable and loyal following wars in the 1990s and 2000s in which it tried to break away from Moscow.

;

;Kadyrov has cultivated the image of a ruthless Putin ally and an aggressive cheerleader for Russia's war in Ukraine, but some commentators suggested he had crossed the line this week by endorsing the attack by his son Adam on prisoner Nikita Zhuravel.

;

;He posted a video showing the younger Kadyrov punching and kicking Zhuravel as the prisoner cowered in a chair, and said he was proud of his son for acquiring “adult ideals of honour, dignity and defence of his religion”.

;

;The alleged Koran-burning did not take place in Chechnya but Russian investigators said they transferred Zhuravel to Chechen custody because Muslims there saw themselves as victims of the incident.

;

;The beating opened up Putin to accusations that he had handed over an ethnic Russian “to be devoured by the Chechens”, former Kremlin speechwriter Abbas Gallyamov, now a harsh Putin critic, said this week. Even pro-Kremlin war commentators described the episode as an outrage.

;

;Kadyrov, 46, has been the subject of intense speculation over his health, with rumours swirling this month that he was dead or in a coma. Last week he published a post on Telegram saying that he was fine, and that his reason for travelling to a Moscow hospital was to visit the bedside of a sick uncle.

;Evergrande's problems have raised the prospect of an intervention by the Chinese authorities to manage any impact to the financial system and the broader economy, analysts said.

;

;"They've managed to avoid the 'bottom line' of preventing a systemic crisis caused by one of the developers so far, and will almost certainly intervene further if Evergrande's situation appears likely to lead to contagion," said Christopher Beddor, deputy director of China research at Gavekal Dragonomics.

;

;"But apart from that, their approach.. has often seemed conflicted and at times incoherent, and that continues today."

;

;Evergrande's shares ended down 19% on Wednesday in the Hong Kong market, taking their losses to 81% since the resumption of trading in late August after a 17-month suspension.

;

;Evergrande's latest woes come against the backdrop of Beijing rolling out a raft of measures in the last few weeks, including cutting of existing mortgage rates, to revive the battered property sector.

;

;On Thursday, the finance ministry said China would exempt from taxes urban land used for affordable housing projects starting October. Buyers of such housing, and housing management firms, will also be exempt from stamp duties, the ministry said.

;

;The recent regulatory easing may stabilize the housing market in the world's second-largest economy to some extent, analysts said, however the appetite for buying property remains subdued in the weak economy.

;

;"Still, the overhang of housing inventories in lower-tier cities facing population decline will persist for several years," Saxo Greater China Market Strategist Redmond Wong wrote in a research note.

;

;"This will lead to more headlines about defaults, restructuring, and liquidation of insolvent developers, causing losses for shareholders, bondholders, banks, and investors in trust and wealth management products tied to property projects."
